ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Discussions about the implications of technology on life & art. How to assemble a virtual world.
I learned a lot about view art and it's connection to technology.

I learned to use multiple platforms, such as Unity, Masterpiece Creator, and more. We learned multiple art concepts that helped us plan and execute our own individual projects. As free as art may seem, it is actually filled with so much structure and there is so much that happens subconsciously that is important in modeling and creating. This class brings to light all of the important things in modeling, in art, in games that those who experience it fail to realize, such as the power it has over the players actions.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The strengths were definitely the VR and non-zoom components and the weaknesses were technical difficulties with software.
We did have some hiccups with software but I think Justin had a pretty good recovery rate with lessons.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: VR & non-zoom meetings were amazing and refreshing in the midst of the pandemic.
I really liked when we met in other online platforms like with the virtual CCAM.
The virtual engagement was amazing, especially when we would escape zoom to meet in other platforms.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes. Relating technology to art is very important and has implications everywhere. The course is fun and interesting.

Yes, the amount of insight that this course has brought me as an artist has been amazing. Not only was the material extremely insightful, but both my professor and my peers have taught me such important concepts along the way that all artist should consider knowing. It was such an intellectually transformative experience, especially when we were able to apply these learned concepts to our projects.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: We also had some classes in VR.
We met in multiple platforms that encouraged our engagement and helped us experience the learned material much better.
